prestige_classes_data.description: Compilation of Prestige Classes for Star Wars SAGA Edition.

prestige_classes_list.name: Ace Pilot
prestige_classes_list.description_general: The ace pilot is to vehicle combat what the elite trooper is to personal weapons combat. Her arms and armor are the weapons and shields of a sleek starship soaring through space or an airspeeder shrieking through the atmosphere. A veteran of countless engagements, the ace pilot has proven her skill again and again by virtue of facing the enemy and survivingâ€”and making sure the enemy did not. She has several kills to her credit, and her combat maneuvers are occasionally studied and discussed in training academies for their ingenuity and effectiveness. [Sourced from CRB p.206]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +4 class bonus to Reflex Defense and +2 class bonus to Fortitude Defense.

other_class_features.description: Beginning at 2nd level, you apply a dodge bonus to the Reflex Defense of any vehicle you pilot. The dodge bonus is equal to one-half your Ace Pilot class level, rounded down (i.e., +1 at 2nd level, +2 at 4th level, +3 at 6th level, +4 at 8th level, and +5 at 10th level). Any condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense also makes you lose dodge bonuses. Also, dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most other types of bonuses.

talent_trees_details.description: The ace pilot relies on finely honed instincts and years of pilot training to outmaneuver and destroy enemy starships. Talents from this tree are available to the Ace Pilot prestige class.
Many starship gunners are skilled both in and out of the cockpit and are deadly with ranged weapons of any kind. Talents from this tree are available to the Ace Pilot prestige class.

Talents for those who prowl the space lanes seeking wealth, fame, adventure, or something more; also good with vehicles. This talent tree is originally from the Scoundrel heroic class (CRB p.47) and is also available to the Ace Pilot prestige class.

level_progression.special_abilities: Mark: single target in LOS, start of encounter, dam bonus, as swif target flat-foot instead

prestige_classes_list.name: Bounty Hunter
prestige_classes_list.description_general: The bounty hunter capitalizes on the vendettas of others, tracking down fugitives for their enemies, their masters, or simply for justice. The best bounty hunters are the ones who can stay emotionally detached from either their employers or their quarryâ€”although bounty hunters who hate their prey often make more spectacular kills. Not all bounty hunters kill. Some employers reserve that pleasure for themselves, or plan to give the quarry a more or less fair trial. [Sourced from CRB p.207]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +4 class bonus to Reflex Defense and +2 class bonus to Fortitude Defense.

other_class_features.description: By observing your enemy in combat, you know how to defeat him more easily. If you spend a full-round action observing an opponent in combat, you gain a bonus on attack rolls against that opponent and a bonus to your Reflex Defense against attacks made by that opponent equal to one-half your Bounty Hunter class level, rounded down (as indicated in the table). The effects last until the end of the encounter. You cannot use this ability until after your opponent has acted during the combat.

prerequisites_structured.name: Awareness Talent x2
prerequisites_structured.text_description: Talents: At least two talents from the Awareness talent tree

prerequisites_summary.talent_prerequisite: At least two talents from the Awareness talent tree (Scout)

talent_trees_details.description: The nature of their work requires bounty hunters to associate with the scum of the universe. You are among the finest bounty hunters in the galaxy, relying on the element of surprise and your hunter's instincts to catch your prey. Talents from this tree are available to the Bounty Hunter prestige class.
Talents available from the Scoundrel's Misfortune talent tree (CRB p.46).
Talents available from the Scout's Awareness talent tree (CRB p.49).

level_progression.special_abilities: Score: full-round observing target, reroll Deception & keep better until end of encounter
Swindle: substitute Deception for Stealth to pick-pocket but you convinced them to give
Executive Leadership: grant ally in LOS one of +2 Spd, +2 Atk, or +2 all Def

prestige_classes_list.name: Crime Lord
prestige_classes_list.description_general: Few societies manage to eradicate crime altogether. In the underworld, someone always rises to the top, either through vision, organization, or sheer intimidation. The life of a crime lord isn't for the timid. After conquering an unseen empire, the crime lord wages a daily struggle not only to stay on top but also to stay alive. [Sourced from CRB p.209]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +2 class bonus to Reflex Defense and +4 class bonus to Will Defense.

other_class_features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your allies to shield you from harm. You gain a +1 cover bonus to your Reflex Defense for each ally that is adjacent to you, up to a maximum bonus equal to one-half your Crime Lord class level (rounded down).

prerequisites_structured.name: Fortune, Lineage, or Misfortune Talent
prerequisites_structured.text_description: Talents: At least one talent from the Fortune, Lineage, or Misfortune talent tree.

prerequisites_summary.talent_prerequisite: At least one talent from the Fortune, Lineage, or Misfortune talent tree

talent_trees_details.description: You are wanted in multiple systems for criminal acts, and your manner of doing business has earned you an unsavory reputation in the criminal underworld. Talents from this tree are available to the Crime Lord prestige class.
You have the ability to attract loyal minions and are skilled at redirecting allies on the battlefield. Talents from this tree are available to the Crime Lord prestige class.
Talents available from the Noble's Influence talent tree (CRB p.43).

level_progression.special_abilities: Networked mind: droid allies can benefit from your mind-affecting effects

prestige_classes_list.name: Elite Trooper
prestige_classes_list.description_general: The elite trooper represents an individual who has received advanced combat training. More than a mere soldier, the elite trooper is highly trained and capable of taking on any number of combat-related missions, such as guarding an important location, assaulting an enemy base, or participating in a stealthy insertion into enemy territory. She's a crack shot and, though trained in the use of armor, can easily operate without it if the situation warrants. [Sourced from CRB p.211]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +2 class bonus to Reflex Defense and +4 class bonus to Fortitude Defense.

other_class_features.description: Elite troopers are among the toughest individuals in the galaxy. After being exposed to numerous threats, foes, and combat situations, you've developed the ability to delay effects that would drop lesser creatures. Once per encounter as a reaction, you can choose to delay the effect of a single attack, ability, or effect used against you. The damage or effect does not take hold until the end of your next turn.

At 2nd level, you gain damage reduction 1 (DR 1). At every even-numbered level after 2nd, your damage reduction improves by 1 (DR 2 at 4th level, DR 3 at 6th level, DR 4 at 8th level, and DR 5 at 10th level).

prerequisites_structured.name: Armor Specialist, Commando, or Weapon Specialist Talent
prerequisites_structured.text_description: Talents: At least one talent from the Armor Specialist, Commando, or Weapon Specialist talent trees

prerequisites_summary.feat_prerequisite: Armor Proficiency (light), Armor Proficiency (medium), Martial Arts I, Point Blank Shot
prerequisites_summary.talent_prerequisite: At least one talent from the Armor Specialist, Commando, or Weapon Specialist talent trees (Soldier)

talent_trees_details.description: You are skilled at wielding a variety of weapons and can wield choice weapons with deadly precision and force. Talents from this tree are available to the Elite Trooper prestige class.
Talents available from the Soldier's Commando talent tree (CRB p.52).
Talents available from the Scout's Camouflage talent tree (CRB p.49).

level_progression.special_abilities: Resources: every level restricted or military equipment = HLx2000, can bank
Targeted Suspect: observe opponent, Atk bonus & Deception,

prerequisites_structured.text_description:
work for law enforcement 
or security organization

prerequisites_summary.OTHER PREREQUISITE:
work for law enforcement 
or security organization

prestige_classes_list.name: Force Adept
prestige_classes_list.description_general: The Force adept is strong in the Force but follows a different path than that of the Jedi. To the Force adept, the Force and the aid it provides are more mysterious, more supernatural. A Force adept comes from a different tradition, with different beliefs and codes of conduct than those of the Jedi. There are precious few Force adepts in the galaxy, and even fewer become adventurers. [Sourced from CRB p.212]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +4 class bonus to Will Defense and +2 class bonus to Reflex and Fortitude Defense.

other_class_features.description: You have learned improved techniques to feel the rhythm of the Force. At every even-numbered level (2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th, and 10th), you gain one Force technique that, once selected, cannot be changed (see Force Techniques, CRB p.101).

prerequisites_summary.talent_prerequisite: Any three Force talents (from CRB Chapter 6)

talent_trees_details.description: Your powerful negative emotions allow the dark side to flow through you, giving you great power. Talents from this tree are available to the Force Adept prestige class. You must have a Dark Side Score of 1 or higher to select talents from this tree; if your Dark Side Score is ever reduced to 0, you lose access to all talents in this talent tree until your Dark Side Score increases.

Force adepts use the Force to survive on fringe worlds, and they often have signature Force powers that they use particularly well. Talents from this tree are available to the Force Adept prestige class.
You can imbue weapons and objects with the power of the Force. Talents from this tree are available to the Force Adept prestige class.

prestige_classes_list.name: Force Disciple
prestige_classes_list.description_general: Through meditation and contemplation of the deepest mysteries of the Force, some individuals transcend the dogma in which they were raised as they reach a new and deeper understanding of their connection to the universe around them. The ebb and flow of lifeâ€”quickening, growing, struggling, dyingâ€”becomes a ceaseless chorus of destiny. Some Force disciples tap into this power, become one with it, and speak its wisdom to others. Others might instead enslave destiny, twist its vision, and corrupt others for the sake of power. Force disciples, like Force adepts, exist in every Force tradition. [Sourced from CRB p.215]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +6 class bonus to Will Defense and +3 class bonus to Reflex Defense and Fortitude Defense.

other_class_features.description: You are immune to mind-affecting effects.

Every time you gain a level in this class, you receive two Destiny Points instead of the usual one. In addition, you may sacrifice this extra Destiny Point immediately after gaining a class level. If you choose to do so, you instead receive a prophetic vision from the Force; the content of this vision is determined by the GM. The vision is instantaneous, so no time is required to exercise this option. Upon seeing the vision, you have the option to choose a new destiny (see CRB p.112) so long as the new destiny is related in some way to the vision. The GM is the final arbiter of what new destiny (or destinies) are appropriate.

You have glimpsed an eternal truth through your contemplation of the Force. At 2nd level and every level thereafter (up to 5th for this 5-level prestige class), you gain one Force secret that, once selected, cannot be changed (see Force Secrets, CRB p.103).

prerequisites_structured.name: Any two from Dark Side Devotee, Force Adept, or Force Item trees
prerequisites_structured.text_description: Talents: Any two talents from the Dark Side Devotee, Force Adept, or Force Item talent tree (see Force Adept prestige class, CRB p.214)

prerequisites_structured.name: Any one
prerequisites_structured.text_description: Force Techniques: Any one (see CRB p.101)

prerequisites_summary.talent_prerequisite: Any two talents from the Dark Side Devotee, Force Adept, or Force Item talent trees (Force Adept PrC)
prerequisites_summary.other_prerequisite: Force Powers: Farseeing. Force Techniques: Any one.

level_progression.special_abilities: Unflinching: once per encounter add Gladiator level to Fort Def

prestige_classes_list.name: Gunslinger
prestige_classes_list.description_general: Since the first primitive slugthrower was developed thousands of years ago, there have been soldiers of fortune focused on pistol fighting. The tradition grew with the technology, creating a special breed of blaster-wielding freelancers who shoot first and ask questions later. Often wandering guns-for-hire, bodyguards in fringe areas, professional duelists, or even assassins, these fighters know everything there is to know about pistols of all descriptions. [Sourced from CRB p.216]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +4 class bonus to Reflex Defense and +2 class bonus to Will Defense.

other_class_features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you gain a bonus on damage rolls equal to one-half your Gunslinger class level (rounded down) when wielding a pistol. This damage is in addition to the character's usual level bonus to damage. This damage is doubled on a successful critical hit, as normal.

prerequisites_summary.feat_prerequisite: Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Quick Draw, Weapon Proficiency (pistols)

talent_trees_details.description: You never travel anywhere without a blaster (or two), and you know how to handle yourself in a gunfight. Talents from this tree are available to the Gunslinger prestige class. Errata: Talents from this tree may only be used with pistols and rifles.
Talents available from the Scoundrel's Fortune talent tree (CRB p.46).
Talents available from the Scout's Awareness talent tree (CRB p.49).

level_progression.special_abilities: Gains Force Techniques
Contraband: Obtain rare or illegal items equal to half level x credits
No Tools Required: always considered to be using a tool kit or security kit
Sapience: can choose to not have droid immunities apply to mind-affecting effects,
Independent Spirit: once per encounter grant yourself morale bonus to one Def
Unarmed stun: unarmed attack deals +1 die dam to stun (+2 at 6th, +3 at 10th)
Lead infiltrator: make Stealth for allies in LOS = Cha mod, allies must stay in LOS

prestige_classes_list.name: Jedi Knight
prestige_classes_list.description_general: Among the Jedi, those of the order who have proven capable, wise, self-sufficient, and stable are given the rank of Knight. A Jedi apprentice must learn to use the Force without instability or strain, build his or her own lightsaber, and show an understanding of the Code of the Jedi. Jedi Knights are trusted to teach apprentices, carry out missions with little aid or support, and use their best judgment when handling the unexpected. [Sourced from CRB p.217-218]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +2 class bonus to Reflex, Fortitude, and Will Defense.

other_class_features.description: You have learned improved techniques to attune yourself to the Force. At every even-numbered level (2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th, and 10th), you gain one Force technique that, once selected, cannot be changed (see Force Techniques, CRB p.101).

prerequisites_structured.text_description: Must have built your own lightsaber (see Building a Lightsaber sidebar, CRB p.40).
Must be a member of the Jedi tradition (see CRB p.104).

prerequisites_summary.special_prerequisite: Must have built your own lightsaber. Must be a member of the Jedi tradition.

talent_trees_details.description: Through rigorous training and experience, you become one of the greatest swordfighters in the galaxy. Talents from this tree are available to the Jedi Knight prestige class.
You have refined your knowledge of lightsaber technique, your blade becoming an extension of your self. Talents from this tree are available to the Jedi Knight prestige class.
Talents available from the Soldier's Armor Specialist talent tree (CRB p.51).
Talents available from the Jedi's Lightsaber Combat talent tree (CRB p.41).

prestige_classes_list.name: Jedi Master
prestige_classes_list.description_general: Jedi Masters represent the pinnacle of the Jedi order. They are Jedi who are both strong enough in the Force and patient enough in life to pass on their skills by teaching a new generation of Jedi. The journey from Padawan learner to Jedi Master usually takes decades, and many who start upon the path never reach its final destination. [Sourced from CRB p.219]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +3 class bonus to Reflex, Fortitude, and Will Defense.

other_class_features.description: You are immune to fear effects.

You may enter a brief meditative state as a full-round action. You may remain in this trance as long as you wish, and you are still aware of your surroundings; however, you are otherwise helpless and cannot perform any other actions (errata). Upon emerging from the trance (a swift action), your first attack roll or Use the Force skill check made in the following round is considered to be a natural 20.

You have meditated on the deeper mysteries of the light side of the Force. At 2nd level and every level thereafter (up to 5th), you gain one Force secret that, once selected, cannot be changed (see Force Secrets, CRB p.103).

prerequisites_structured.text_description: Must be a member of the Jedi tradition (see CRB p.104).

prerequisites_summary.special_prerequisite: Must be a member of the Jedi tradition.

talent_trees_details.description: Talents available from the Jedi Knight's Duelist talent tree (CRB p.218).
Talents available from any Force talent tree in Chapter 6: The Force (CRB p.100-102): Alter, Control, Dark Side, Sense, Light Side.

level_progression.special_abilities: Tough as Durasteel: When you damage a target with an unarmed atk, gain bonus hp

prerequisites_summary.FEAT PREREQUISITE: Martial Arts I&II, Melee Defense, 1 Martial Arts Training

level_progression.special_abilities: Veteran Privateer: you can add +2 Atk to yourself as a free action
Piracy: If you are lost to the dark side, you may not take any further levels of master privateer.

prerequisites_summary.TALENT PREREQUISITE:
2 from Misfortune, Smuggling,
or Spacer (all Scoundrel)

level_progression.special_abilities: Improved First Aid
target gains +1hp for every point over the DC
Improved Heal Damage
surgery heals an additional number of hp = your class level
Improved Long-Term Care
long-term care heals an additional number of hp = your class level
Improved Perform Surgery
perform surgery in half the time
Improved Revivify
revivify as stan not full
Master of Movement/(no. of times per encounter): ignore movement penalty on a single move action

prerequisites_summary.FEAT PREREQUISITE:
Melee Def, Rapid Strike,
Weapon Focus (any melee)

level_progression.special_abilities: Field-created weapon: 1/enc as stan, DC20 Mechanics to create weapon

prestige_classes_list.name: Officer
prestige_classes_list.description_general: Even the best-trained troops need someone to make decisions and provide direction. The officer fills that role but also takes responsibility when the troops fail in their appointed tasks. They frequently also suffer the disrespect of their subordinates, who often see the uniform as a symbol of oppression. [Sourced from CRB p.220]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +2 class bonus to Reflex Defense and +4 class bonus to Will Defense.

other_class_features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your allies to shield you from harm. You gain a +1 cover bonus to your Reflex Defense for each ally that is adjacent to you, up to a maximum bonus equal to one-half your Officer class level (rounded down).

At every even-numbered level, choose a talent that you already possess. The talent you select must be under the Influence talent tree, the Inspiration talent tree, the Commando talent tree, or the Military Tactics talent tree. Once per day as a standard action, you can impart the benefits of the chosen talent to one or more allies, effectively granting them the talent (even if they don't meet the prerequisites). An ally must be within 10 squares of you and must be able to see and hear you to gain the talent; once gained, its benefits last until the end of the encounter. You can share the talent with a number of allies equal to one-half your officer class level (rounded down). Each time you gain this ability, it applies to a different talent. Once you select a shared talent, it cannot be changed.

prerequisites_structured.name: Leadership or Commando Talent
prerequisites_structured.text_description: Talents: At least one talent from the Leadership talent tree or Commando talent tree
Must belong to an organization with a military or paramilitary division.

prerequisites_summary.talent_prerequisite: At least one talent from the Leadership talent tree (Noble) or Commando talent tree (Soldier)
prerequisites_summary.special_prerequisite: Must belong to an organization with a military or paramilitary division.

talent_trees_details.description: Officers study old battles, looking for historic examples of good military tactics. You are an expert at leading troops into battle and using the battlefield to your advantage. Talents from this tree are available to the Officer prestige class.
Talents available from the Noble's Leadership talent tree (CRB p.44).
Talents available from the Soldier's Commando talent tree (CRB p.52).

level_progression.special_abilities: Fugitive: 1/encounter, move +X squares during withdraw

prerequisites_structured.text_description: Must be wanted by the authorities in at least one system

prerequisites_summary.OTHER PREREQUISITE: Must be wanted by the authorities in at least one system

level_progression.special_abilities: Create Cover: Designate an area of squares equal to half your level, within 6 squares from you.
This area is considered to give cover from distant fire.
Unexpected results: If an enemy rolls a nat 1 v. you immediately disabled until repaired
Destructive: you always deal double damage to unattended vehicles or objects
Quick Sabotage: disable devices w/improvised tools & no kit, at 4th simple swif
Master saboteur: reroll any Mechanics to disable device or handle explosives, take best
Shaper Lore: Gain a bonus 1/2 class level to Knowledge(life sciences) and Treat Injury for biotech
Shaper Hand: Gains artificial hand that replaces the need for a biotech toolkit.

prestige_classes_list.name: Sith Apprentice
prestige_classes_list.description_general: The Sith apprentice combines combat mastery with the power of the dark side to create a living embodiment of rage and savagery. Physical conditioning and punishing discipline make the Sith apprentice into a formidable opponent, and facility with the powers of the dark side add a wicked barb to an otherwise deadly weapon. The Sith apprentice is dedicated to the conquest and subjugation of any obstacle to the Sith tradition. [Sourced from CRB p.223]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +2 class bonus to Reflex, Fortitude, and Will Defense.

other_class_features.description: You have learned improved techniques to control the Force. At every even-numbered level (2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th, and 10th), you gain one Force technique that, once selected, cannot be changed (see Force Techniques, CRB p.101).

prerequisites_structured.text_description: Dark Side Score: Your Dark Side Score must be equal to your Wisdom score.
Must be a member of the Sith tradition (see CRB p.105).

prerequisites_summary.special_prerequisite: Dark Side Score must be equal to Wisdom score. Must be a member of the Sith tradition.

talent_trees_details.description: The Sith tradition believes in order through tyranny. Talents from this tree are available to the Sith Apprentice prestige class.
Talents available from the Soldier's Armor Specialist talent tree (CRB p.51).
Talents available from the Jedi Knight's Duelist talent tree (CRB p.218).
Talents available from the Jedi's Lightsaber Combat talent tree (CRB p.41).
Talents available from the Force Talent Tree: Alter (CRB p.100).
Talents available from the Force Talent Tree: Control (CRB p.101).
Talents available from the Force Talent Tree: Sense (CRB p.101).
Talents available from the Force Talent Tree: Dark Side (CRB p.101).

prestige_classes_list.name: Sith Lord

available_talent_trees.description: The Sith tradition believes in order through tyranny. Talents from this tree are available to the Sith Apprentice prestige class.
Talents available from the Force Talent Tree: Alter (CRB p.100).
Talents available from the Force Talent Tree: Control (CRB p.101).
Talents available from the Force Talent Tree: Sense (CRB p.101).
Talents available from the Force Talent Tree: Dark Side (CRB p.101).

prestige_classes_list.description_general: The Sith Lord is the pinnacle of the Sith tradition. Her most sacred tasks include preserving the lore and glory of the Sith and plotting their eventual ascendance to their place as rulers of the galaxy. The Sith Lord must allow nothing to stand in the way of this goal. [Sourced from CRB p.224]

game_rule_information.defense_bonuses_text: At 1st level, +3 class bonus to Reflex, Fortitude, and Will Defense.

other_class_features.description: You are immune to fear effects.

You are adept at using Dun Moch, an ancient and vile technique for tempting others to tap into the dark side of the Force. As a standard action, make a Persuasion check and compare it to the Will Defense of a single opponent within line of sight. If the check succeeds, the target is filled with fear or anger, briefly giving in to the dark side. If the target spends a Force Point before your next turn, it must either add 1 point to its Dark Side Score or move -1 step on the condition track as it is overcome by doubt and remorse. If the target spends a Destiny Point before your next turn, it instead must add 2 points to its Dark Side Score or move -2 steps on the condition track.

You have learned forbidden secrets of tapping the dark side of the Force. At 2nd level and every level thereafter (up to 5th), you gain one Force secret that, once selected, cannot be changed (see Force Secrets, CRB p.103).

prerequisites_structured.text_description: Dark Side Score: Your Dark Side Score must be equal to your Wisdom score.
Must be a member of the Sith tradition (see CRB p.105).

prerequisites_summary.special_prerequisite: Dark Side Score must be equal to Wisdom score. Must be a member of the Sith tradition.

talent_trees_details.description: Talents available from the Sith Apprentice's Sith talent tree (CRB p.223).
Talents available from any Force talent tree in Chapter 6: The Force (CRB p.100-102): Alter, Control, Dark Side, Sense.

level_progression.special_abilities: Surprise Attack: if target is unaware of you or lost Dex to Ref Def gain Atk bonus on first attack
